bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, December 9, 1947

div1.p: Hench discusses the room in which Reed died and his desire that it be memorialized. He wonders if the American Society for Tropical Medicine or some other organization would provide funds for a bronze plaque.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, December 9, 1947
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
December 9, 1947
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
General Jefferson R. Kean
2804 N Street, N. W.
Georgetown
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Kean:
div1.p:
It was so nice to see you and Mrs. Kean again, although our trip
was so hurried. I enclose some rather poorly printed copies of the photographs
which we took of the room in which Walter Reed died. I am sending a set
to General Truby, asking him to write out a statement of identification which
will satisfy the Walter Reed Memorial Association. Thereafter, I will ask
Colonel Siler to request, through the Surgeon General, in the name of the
Association, that a modest temporary wooden plaque be placed on the outside
of the building, somewhere on the porch and another one in the second floor
hall just outside the room.

You are so excellent in coining appropriate phrases, may I suggest
that you are the rightful one to suggest the wording that should be on this
plaque. Should it not be a simple statement to the fact that “In this room
(or in this building) on such and such a date, the great Army physician,
Walter Reed, died”. Thereafter might be added the statement on his tomb
“He gave to mankind freedom from yellow fever” or some such. I am sure
that you can make a much nicer statement than this.

If we had any assurance that the life of this little building might
be sufficiently long, is it not possible that the American Society for Tropical
Medicine or some other organization would give the funds for a bronze plaque?

As soon as I can, I will have my Virginia talk copied and send you
one.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
